articles.author: Jacob Paul
articles.title: Solar storm warning as ‘double whammy’ flare to batter Earth TONIGHT - Daily Express
articles.description: TWO incoming solar storms heading straight for Earth tonight that could put the stunning Northern Lights on display may also disrupt global communications and cause power outages.

articles.author: Ryan Morrison
articles.title: Signs of WATER are detected in a galaxy 12.88 billion light years from Earth - Daily Mail
articles.description: It was found in SPT0311-58, a massive galaxy dating to when the universe was just 780 million years old, according to University of Illinois astronomers.
articles.content:
Signs of water have been detected in a galaxy 12.8 billion light years from the Earth, making it the most distant, and earliest discovered so far, astronomers claim.

articles.author: Stacy Liberatore
articles.title: NASA's Curiosity rover has discovered organic molecules such as ammonia on Mars - Daily Mail
articles.description: NASA's Curiosity rover discovered benzoic acid and ammonia in dirt collected from Mars. Both of which are found to occur naturally in plants and animals, including humans.
articles.content:
NASA's Curiosity rover has discovered previously unknown organic molecules, ammonia and benzoic acid, on Mars that could be possible indicators of ancient life.
The findings stem from a new techniqu… [+5694 chars]

articles.author: Chris Ciaccia
articles.title: NASA has discovered a 'superbubble' in the middle of a nebula 170,000 light-years from Earth - Daily Mail
articles.description: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope has discovered a 'superbubble,' an area without stars, inside a nebula that is more than 170,000 light-years away from Earth.
articles.content: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope still isn't working, but scientists combing through its data have discovered a 'superbubble' in the middle of a nebula in deep space that could have been formed by massi… [+5211 chars]

articles.title: Where *isn't* Planet 9? - SYFY WIRE

articles.title: Mysterious comet has been having multiple large outbursts - Phys.org
articles.description: Amateur and professional astronomers have found that the comet 29P/Schwassmann-Wachmann has been experiencing an unusually large outburst recently. Normally, it has little outbursts spread throughout the year.
